Billiardtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputConsider abilliard tableof rectangular size $$$n \\times m$$$ with four pockets. Let's introduce a coordinate system with the origin at the lower left corner (see the picture).There is one ball at the point $$$(x, y)$$$ currently. Max comes to the table and strikes the ball. The ball starts moving along a line that is parallel to one of the axes or that makes a $$$45^{\\circ}$$$ angle with them. We will assume that:the angles between the directions of the ball before and after a collision with a side are equal,the ball moves indefinitely long, it only stops when it falls into a pocket,the ball can be considered as a point, it falls into a pocket if and only if its coordinates coincide with one of the pockets,initially the ball is not in a pocket.Note that the ball can move along some side, in this case the ball will just fall into the pocket at the end of the side.Your task is to determine whether the ball will fall into a pocket eventually, and if yes, which of the four pockets it will be.InputThe only line contains $$$6$$$ integers $$$n$$$, $$$m$$$, $$$x$$$, $$$y$$$, $$$v_x$$$, $$$v_y$$$ ($$$1 \\leq n, m \\leq 10^9$$$, $$$0 \\leq x \\leq n$$$; $$$0 \\leq y \\leq m$$$; $$$-1 \\leq v_x, v_y \\leq 1$$$; $$$(v_x, v_y) \\neq (0, 0)$$$) — the width of the table, the length of the table, the $$$x$$$-coordinate of the initial position of the ball, the $$$y$$$-coordinate of the initial position of the ball, the $$$x$$$-component of its initial speed and the $$$y$$$-component of its initial speed, respectively. It is guaranteed that the ball is not initially in a pocket.OutputPrint the coordinates of the pocket the ball will fall into, or $$$-1$$$ if the ball will move indefinitely.ExamplesInput4 3 2 2 -1 1Output0 0Input4 4 2 0 1 1Output-1Input10 10 10 1 -1 0Output-1NoteThe first sample:The second sample:In the third sample the ball will never change its $$$y$$$ coordinate, so the ball will never fall into a pocket.

You are given a rectangular table of size $n \times m$ with four pockets. A ball is initially at position $(x, y)$ and has a velocity of $(v_x, v_y)$. The ball moves in a straight line, either horizontally, vertically, or at a 45-degree angle.  

After hitting a side of the table, the ball bounces off at the same angle. The ball continues moving indefinitely until it falls into a pocket.

Determine if the ball will eventually fall into a pocket and, if so, which pocket. If the ball never falls into a pocket, output -1. 

**Input:**

* $n$: width of the table
* $m$: length of the table
* $x$: x-coordinate of the ball's initial position
* $y$: y-coordinate of the ball's initial position
* $v_x$: x-component of the ball's velocity
* $v_y$: y-component of the ball's velocity

**Output:**

* The coordinates of the pocket the ball falls into, or -1 if the ball never falls into a pocket.

A ball is on a rectangular table with four pockets. The ball moves in a straight line at a constant speed, either horizontally, vertically, or at a 45-degree angle.  Determine if the ball will eventually fall into a pocket and, if so, which pocket.
